alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 17 at 6:16PM CDT until June 17 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Brown County in west central Texas... Southeastern Coleman County in west central Texas... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Santa Anna, Trickham, Shields, Fisk and Mozelle. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1176 crossing Sweetie Creek, County Road 300 crossing Home Creek, County Road 348 crossing Bull Creek, crossings along County Road 302, County Road 258 crossing Home Creek, County Road 176 crossing east Fork Mukewater Creek, CR 270 crossing Home Creek and County Road 166 crossing east Fork Mukewater Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
